charity.description:
Protecting rainforest is the smartest climate action we can take, no matter where we live. 

That's why Cool Earth works to find the best ways to keep rainforest standing strong by putting the needs and rights of local people first.
charity.name: Cool Earth
eventName: NUSU RAG The Peaks of the Balkans Trek 2021
story:
Cool Earth is the charity that works alongside rainforest communities to prevent deforestation and its impact on climate change.

Cool Earth helps local communities build sustainable livelihoods to improve their incomes, empowering them to protect and conserve their trees and the multitude of wildlife living within them. It believes that healthier and more financially resilient communities will put less pressure on the biologically diverse ecosystems they live in.  Pulling people out of poverty leads to strong communities and strong forests.

Cool Earth is proud to partner with NUSU RAG and Endeavours Adventures for the Peaks of the Balkans challenge event.
title: Newcastle Treks the Peaks of the Balkans

charity.description: A child dies every two minutes from malaria. We are one of the world’s leading non profit organisations specialising in protecting the most vulnerable from the burden of malaria and other communicable diseases. To know more about how we spend your money and where we work, please visit our website.
charity.name: Malaria Consortium
story:
On Sunday the 6th of September I am running the Andover Trail Marathon (my first ever marathon!) and hoping to raise as much money for Malaria Consortium as I can. I've paid for entry myself, so every pound given will go straight to the charity. All contributions help :) 

It's a tough time for us all at the moment. In the face of unrelenting headlines about the latest Trump tweet, Covid-19, as well as our own inept rulers, it's easy to lose sight of those beyond our homes. The stress caused by Covid-19 is something we have all now come to know. 

While there isn't a treatment for Covid yet, there is one for Malaria. The medicine a child needs has a 75% success rate in preventing disease, and only costs $6.80 for four seasons. Over the last few months we have all lost some of our normal, but there are still ways for us to make a difference. Thank you!


A bit about Malaria Consortium: 

Help us reach more of these children this Christmas with mosquito nets, with diagnostic kits, with medicine, with love.Bring smiles and joy to families across Africa and Asia by supporting Malaria Consortium today.$10 can help to buy a bed net to keep mosquitoes away while a child sleeps$25 can help to buy the medicines a child needs to guard against malaria$50 can help to train a health worker to test for malaria and provide medicines$100 can help to equip a medical facility that can care for a communityYour gift has the power to save lives.Malaria can be stopped. Join Malaria Consortium today as we fight against one of the world's biggest killers.

charity.name: Malaria Consortium
story:
Help us reach more of these children this Christmas with mosquito nets, with diagnostic kits, with medicine.

$10
For less than an iRacing track, you can help buy a bed net to keep 
mosquitoes away while a child sleeps!

$25
For less than a three-month sub to iRacing you can help buy medicines a child needs to guard against malaria!

$50
For less than a year of iRacing, you can help train a health worker to test for malaria and provide medicines 

$100
You are basically Jesus and have single-handedly equipped a medical facility that could care for an entire community!

Amazingly unlike a T1 crashes malaria is one of the few things that can be stopped so let's poke away at it now.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
We've set this page up within the "Oxfam Winter Challenge" so supporters of the Oxfam St Albans Group can donate together and share updates. (Don't worry, whatever page you are on, Oxfam will get the benefit of your donation)

We're on a trek from outside the Oxfam Chequer St shop in St Albans  to Cox's Bazar (Bangladesh), a distance of 20,000 km (!), visiting Oxfam projects along the way. We'll see the challenges communities face, ranging from conflict, to Covid-19  and the impact of the climate emergency, and learn how Oxfam is responding, enabling communities to thrive, not just survive. 

With your support, Oxfam can continue its life-saving work, it can continue to put together packages of food, give farming support, set up foodbanks, support education for women and girls, and provide cash to buy essentials. 

As examples: 

  • for each £15 we raise, we're helping more women to understand their rights, challenge discrimination and to take up leadership roles within their local communities. 
  • For each £35, we  can ensure families have access to emergency food supplies. 
  • And £45 will provide one of our new handwashing stations to enable frequent handwashing and disease prevention. With your support, communities can come together to help each other.
title: Oxfam Community Winter Challenge
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
Name: Oxfam Community Winter Challenge

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Thank you to Unilever for supporting Oxfam's response in Indonesia.

A powerful 7.4 magnitude earthquake has triggered a devastating tsunami on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. Right now, people are still trapped. Families have been torn apart. Lives are on the line. There is no time to waste. 

People are in desperate need of food, water and shelter. Please help us reach them before its too late. 

More than 2 million people could be affected by the disaster, which has forced thousands from their homes. The death toll has reached over 1,300 people. As rescuers work around the clock to find survivors in the rubble, it's expected to rise even further. Due to the scale of the destruction, we urgently need your help to get clean water, food and shelter to survivors in the worst hit areas. 

We are aiming to reach 500,000 people in Palu city and Donggala district with life-saving supplies but we cannot do it without you.

Please help if you can and donate now. Thank you.
title: Indonesia Earthquake and Tsunami Appeal

Name: Indonesia Earthquake and Tsunami Appeal

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
With our usual local fair stalls cancelled we thought we would bring some of our usual activities online.  We are hosting a variety of activities over the coming months that you might usually find at your local fair, all in aid of Oxfam's Coronavirus Appeal.

Our local fundraising group is deeply concerned about how Coronavirus is affecting people living through conflict, disaster and poverty.  Oxfam's humanitarian staff are working hard to stop the spread.  Oxfam is providing vital support like hand washing, clean water, toilets and soap to the most vulnerable communities.  

Work like this has helped contain deadly disease outbreaks such as Ebola and cholera and it will protect people against this virus.

In some areas, Oxfam is also providing vital equipment to healthcare facilities and hospitals that urgently need support. And as ever, they are helping people who are losing income or at greater risk of domestic abuse because of restrictions on movement. Supporting the world's poorest communities is more important than ever right now.

Its a difficult time for everyone but anything you can do to support can make a difference and save lives. Thank you.

Charity Reg No - 202918

Oxfam Reading Area Group are a group of local volunteers who are raising money on behalf of Oxfam and do not represent Oxfam or have any connection to Oxfam GB.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
6km is the distance people have to walk everyday just to get clean water for themselves and their families.  I am thankful everyday that I do not have to do this but I am passionate about this challenge to walk in their shoes and hopefully raise enough funds for a village to have its own clean water supply and combat poverty and climate change at the same time - Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. Together, we won't live with poverty


6km is the average distance walked in Sub-Saharan Africa to collect one person's daily water supply of 15L

charity.name: Oxfam
eventName: Oxfam St Albans Walk for Water 2020
story:
With shops closed and festivals cancelled, Oxfam needs our support more than ever. However, circumstances mean we can’t offer our Walk for Water in the usual way, as bringing walkers and helpers together at Walk HQ and at places round the routes would not be responsible. If
we can waymark some routes on certain dates, we’ll announce it.

So, we are switching to a flexible approach and one that fits the current lifestyle emphasis on outdoor exercise.

Start your Walk for Water efforts now by logging your countryside walks. Follow the classic 3, 5, 8 and 15 mile Oxfam routes, which we will post on our website www.oxfamstalbans.org, together with our extra suggestions, and develop your own favourite walks and tell us about them. Email Oxfamstalbans1@gmail.com to enrol now!

Write in to us with your photos and news of where you have been. Let’s build a “Walk for Water” community this year. Who can log up the greatest mileage?

Our original event date of 26 September can be the target date for completing fundraising.

We know that Oxfam will have great needs to meet in the water, Sanitation and Hygiene fields – its special areas of expertise – so we want to rise to the challenge and fundraise as much as before. Join in and help us get there!

The money placed on this Justgiving page will be available for Oxfam’s use within a few days, helping it to respond to Covid-19 situations and people in need.

charity.name: Oxfam
eventName: Oxfam St Albans Walk for Water 2020
story:
The Strollers, from Homewood Rd URC and Trinity URC, have long supported the Oxfam Walk for Water. We'll be logging our walks, bike rides and trips out, and donating so Oxfam can get clean water, handwash stations and toilet facilities to people in need. We can mark Harvest time too, by donating here.

We'll walk the traditional routes of 3, 5, or 8 miles (or perhaps more?), and add new ones too. Let's enjoy the best of the beautiful Hertfordshire countryside so close to home - the views, the wildlife, the flowers and trees. We'll be donating or collecting sponsorship for Oxfam Water projects. 

A handwashing station for Refugee Camps costs £45 to make - how many can we sponsor?

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.

Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. We couldn't do our work without you.

Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. 

Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Too many people around the world live in cramped conditions, with no access to clean water or proper handwashing facilities, and are already facing crises like conflict and hunger. For these communities, coronavirus could be catastrophic.

Were doing everything we can to protect the poorest people from coronavirus. But we need your help to do more.

Your support helps us deliver soap, clean water and sanitation services such as handwashing facilities to keep more families safe.

Its a difficult time for everyone  but anything you can do to support can make a difference and save lives. Thank you.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Hi 👋🏻 My name is Lydia and this February I'll be running/walking/crawling 100km across the muddy downs* in Bristol to raise money for Oxfam to help them support communities who are dealing with the most severe effects of the climate crisis.

Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, wrecking lives and displacing whole communities. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped. Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. 

Through all of this, they rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure their dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. No one makes change alone so every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference!!

Thank you xxx


*or at home, whatever is in line with lockdown guidelines at the time.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
As a dedicated Oxfam festival steward, I can usually take for granted that my summer will be filled with amazing times, lots of fun and fundraising for Oxfam! Sadly Covid 19 means that this didn't happen in 2020 and 2021 isn't looking so certain either!

Volunteering for Oxfam in the summer means that I help people out twice - helping festival attendees, while also raising money for people around the world. The free festival ticket usually works out pretty well for me too.

Recently, I've been litter picking around my local area and the bonus for me is lots of lovely thankyous, and it's also good exercise, even though I'm not moving very far!

There's a challenge I want to take on - the area where I work, around Burton Street in Hillsborough/Langsett in Sheffield. It could be really nice, with greenspaces to relax in, but it's full of rubbish that's been building up for years.

On Saturday 6th February, I will be doing my own litterpicking "Marathon" for Oxfam: eight hours of litterpicking around this area in one day, starting at 9am and finishing at 5pm, unless I get carried away! Volunteers are welcome to join me on the day. You could even do your own litterpick at home. It will result in a much nicer area that I'm proud of and is safe for people and wildlife.

I'm in training at the moment, tackling local rubbish, so I'll be ready for my marathon task!

Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. We couldn't do our work without you.Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Here we go again to prepare for our deferred covid impacted 2020 entry! A combination of unfinished business and enjoyment for the 2019 event has meant that I’m back to try and once again conquer the mighty South Downs. 

The 2019 team completed the event in just over 23hrs - with a revised focus of a sub 20hr time 💪🏽.

Joining me is fellow 2019 team member Adrian Pinnock who wants again leads the team along with two new fresh and hungry walkers of Nick Dixon and Ben Locke.

Together we become the third reincarnation of the original 2017 team; Rochefort Four Vol 3.1 (3.0 is the 2020 Covid impacted team that never saw the hills!)

In the vitally important support crew role are Martyn Lillywhite and Owen Kenny.

So how can you help? We need to raise £1400 as a team just £350 a member so I would massively appreciate it if you could reach into your pockets and help me out 🙏🏽

The Charity

Trailwalker is the endurance challenge of a lifetime. Around 500 teams of 4 will take on 100km of the South Downs Way in September. All the while, helping to end poverty with each step. The money raised will be used by Oxfam and The Gurkha Welfare Trust to improve lives around the world.

Oxfam is a movement of millions of people, all working towards one goal - an end to poverty to everyone. In over 70 years we've become world leaders in emergency water and sanitation, and experts in providing shelter, food and protection.

 The Gurkha Welfare Trust provide financial, medical and development aid to Gurkha veterans, their families and communities in Nepal as well as welfare advice to the UK Gurkha Community.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

THANK YOU & Namaste.
title: The Oxfam Trailwalker 2021. Tackling global poverty one step at a time!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
This year has been a roller coaster, but coming close to the
end now, along with my colleagues from  the Festivals & Events Team at Oxfam, I decided to join Trailwalker Relay and walk 100km (divided in 4 and together as a team), on the week of 21-27th September to show my love and support to an amazing charity of which I am proud to be a part of.

TRAILWALKER started out as a military training exercise in Hong Kong in 1981. Organised by the Queen's Gurkha Signals, and taking place along the famous Maclehose Trail, the exercise sought to test the endurance and teamwork of soldiers of the Queen's Gurkha Signals over a long and arduous course.

The Trailwalker Relay is  the virtual TRAILWALKER challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

story:
Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.

Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. We couldn't do our work without you.

Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. 

Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
The Ethical Fitness Challenge is a 4 week goal-oriented challenge that combines getting fit with doing good. I am committing to walking and stepping daily to raise money for Oxfam GB to help communities deal with the frequent and extreme weather that is destroying homes and wrecking lives. My £100 target could help build toilet and washing facilities for families who have been made homeless, or it could feed a family of six for a month. 

I will of course also improve my own physical fitness and my mental wellbeing too as well as the world around me - so it's a win-win! I will post reg pics from my local daily exercise/walks and screenshots of steps covered as proof.

Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Through all of this, Oxfam rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure their dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. They couldn't do our work without your donations - and with charity shops closed right now cos of lockdown they need all the help they can get. Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. Please give what you can.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Mindwave
A health technology company with a conscience, we pledge to spend the next 4 weeks making healthier habits (which is also great user research for some of our projects) whilst raising lots of money for Oxfam. 

Between us, we are going to complete at least 200 hours of physical activity in 4 weeks, by cycling, running, walking, hopping, skipping, swimming, crawling... you get the idea!

We will take lots of photos and keep each other accountable as a team.

Lockdown 3.0 - you don't stand a chance.


Oxfam
Climate change is affecting millions of the world's poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. story: More frequent and extreme weather caused by climate change is destroying habitats and homes and wrecking lives. Those who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest. As well as campaigning to see action and tangible commitments by governments and big business, I want to contribute in some way to helping build resilience within communities worst affected. Over the next four weeks, my goal is to cycle 15 miles a week - or a grand total of 60 miles, since I'm at the mercy of winter weather. Thank you for your support :)

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.

Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. We couldn't do our work without you.

Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. 

Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Over the next 4 weeks I have set myself the challenge of running 50 miles to take part in the Ethical Fitness Challenge for Oxfam! 

As I am very new to running and hate winter I expect this won't be easy! However, I hope this will improve my mental and physical wellbeing during lockdown #3 whilst also raising money for a very worthy cause.  Follow my progress on here and  @sustainablefashionjournal and please give what you can. 

Why am I running?!

Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. 

Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. We couldn't do our work without you.Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
As a family, our 2021 goal is to be become fitter, healthier and leaner, physically and mentally. We started by weighing ourselves every month during lockdown in the spring of 2020, knowing we all needed to lose a few pounds! We now want to step up our efforts, and make a change, not just to our own bodies, but also to help improve others. 

We are lucky that we have the money, time and opportunity to be able to eat what we like, and it seems absurd that we have allowed ourselves to indulge, when there are families like ours across the world that are struggling to feed themselves, through no fault of their own. 

So we will be over the year, eating more healthily, becoming more active, and engaging in conversation and action to raise awareness of the work Oxfam does. 

Thanks for supporting us and Oxfam 💫


Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.

Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. 

Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. 

We couldn't do our work without you.

Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. 

Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Climate change is affecting millions of the worlds poorest people, right now. More frequent and extreme weather is destroying homes, and wrecking lives. The people who have done the least to cause the climate emergency are being hit the hardest this is an injustice that can and must be stopped.

Oxfam is protecting families forced to flee their homes, supporting those hit by changing weather, making sure children have a chance of a future free from poverty and responding to the deadly threat of coronavirus. Through all of this, we rely on brilliant supporters like you to make sure our dedicated teams can be where they're needed most. We couldn't do our work without you.

Every donation, no matter how big or small, makes a difference. 

Together, we won't live with poverty.

charity.name: Oxfam
eventName: Help save the female head porters from the spread of Covid19.
story:
Too many people around the world live in cramped conditions, with no access to clean water or proper handwashing facilities, and are already facing crises like conflict and hunger. For these communities, coronavirus could be catastrophic.

Were doing everything we can to protect the poorest people from coronavirus. But we need your help to do more.

Your support helps us deliver soap, clean water and sanitation services such as handwashing facilities to keep more families safe.

Its a difficult time for everyone  but anything you can do to support can make a difference and save lives. Thank you.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Oxjam is a festival like no other.

A new type of music festival that is part of Oxfams rich musical history.

Oxjam started 2006 with the aim of creating a network of music-loving people across the UK, all united by a shared goal  to raise money to fight poverty and suffering around the world.

Its a community festival run by volunteers and made up of multi-venue festivals and gigs taking place across the UK throughout October. Its all about supporting independent music venues and providing a platform for up and coming musical talent while raising money to fight poverty and inequality worldwide. Now thats something we can all get behind.

Since 2006 weve gone on to host more than 60,000 musicians playing to an audience of 1.5 million people, raising well over £2.8 million. We've also helped break bands such as Everything Everything, Foals, Young Fathers and Drenge. Weve also had backing from the likes of Metronomy, Annie Mac, Mr Jukes and Fatboy Slim.

pageSummary: Organising a grassroots music festival because Oxjam will help beat poverty through music!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story:
Update: thank you so much to everyone for your kind donations. Unfortunately, Trailwalker 2020 has been canceled due to the Covid-19 pandemic so I won't be taking part this year. There may be some sort of virtual challenge organised instead. If you would like your donation refunded please let me know and I will send you the contact details to request this.

Otherwise, I'll be taking part in 2021 so keep your eyes peeled for my page for that! 


Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. As you train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, you will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money you raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
I profess to love the outdoors and the hills but I certainly haven't been practising what I preach so far in life.

Last year Katie persuaded me and my mum to walk the 21 mile Stroud 5 Valleys Walk for Meningitis Now. That day easily doubled my longest ever walk.

This year Katie took it up a notch...how about 100km in 30 hours over the South Downs.

"No absolutely not, no way!"

Cut to holiday a few weeks and a few wines later. We're signed up and dragging some more friends (Zoe and Mollie) along for the ride. 

After narrowly avoiding signing up as a military team and optimistically setting our target finish time of "I just want to finish in the 30 hours." We're doing it. Now we just need to tap all of our friends and family and randomers we know to donate.

Read more about the event and the charities below:

Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. As you train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, you will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money you raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

Gurkha Welfare Trust:

"We ensure that Gurkha veterans, their widows and their wider communities are able to live with dignity. We achieve this primarily through the provision of financial, medical and community aid in Nepal. We operate through 22 Area Welfare Centres spread across traditional Gurkha recruiting areas. In the UK, in conjunction with other service charities and government bodies we offer advice and support to help the thousands of retired Gurkhas and their families who choose to settle here."

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
I’m September Kai, Joey, Paul and myself will be hiking 100km (62 miles) in just 30 hours across the stunningly beautiful landscape of the South Downs. Between us we have a wealth of experience in cross country hiking, and have traveled across the South Downs on a number of occasions. If 100km in 30 hours was not challenging enough, the journey will also involve 4,900m of rises and falls! We will also have the addition of a support team lead by Melody who will keep meeting up with us at various check points along the route. This challenge will be done for the Oxfam charity, supported by the Gurkha Army, and we will be aiming to raise £1400.00 for this charity. Thank you for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page and for your support with this fantastic challenge! Cameron. 

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
The girls and I have decided to sleep out in our hammocks for 26 hours over 3 nights to raise money to help families who don’t have the luxury of going in for a hot shower, clean water and a big breakfast after a night in the open.

  In refugee camps around the world there can be 250 people sharing 1 tap! £35 could provide clean water for 7 families for a month!  Let’s try and raise enough money to help those families for a whole year! 🙏❤️
title: 26 hours sleeping under the stars!!
pageSummary: To help provide clean water and safe shelter. because We are so lucky to have both 🙏

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Too many people around the world live in cramped conditions, with no access to clean water or proper handwashing facilities, and are already facing crises like conflict and hunger. For these communities, coronavirus could be catastrophic.

Were doing everything we can to protect the poorest people from coronavirus. But we need your help to do more.

Your support helps us deliver soap, clean water and sanitation services such as handwashing facilities to keep more families safe.

Its a difficult time for everyone  but anything you can do to support can make a difference and save lives. Thank you.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
So.... Well....
This isnt the description i meant to write for this year but hell, we all know its been an effed up year on so many levels!

Trailwalker 2020 is cancelled, as all my other events have been but this is the only one i would fundraise for, so, like in 2018, i need another challenge to take on to help raise money for two really great charities.
(I`m sure you will already know but TW is in aid of Oxfam and Gurkha Welfare Trust) 

To make up for the loss of TW, Hailey and I are taking on the whole SDW (100miles) over 4 days this August.  We will be camping each night and carrying all our kit with us... which is as daunting as the mileage itself!  Getting up each morning after a highly questionable night's sleep in our tents and doing it all over again will be a real test!

To add to this, in September, Oxfam have come up with a TW Virtual Relay. This is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week.  Hailey and I are also going to take on this challenge to boost raising money.  We still have some planning to do but both of us will be putting the boots back on and pushing ourselves to complete this challenge.

Anyway, thank you for reading and hopefully thank you for donating towards these two summer challenges. Need to get my training boots back on!!

story:
Dear Family, Friends and Colleagues,

We, Basanta, Mohan, Ajib and Sagar will be running a distance of 100km Trailwalker Relay 2020 (25km each) representing Intake 06, 247 Gurkha Signal Squadron on Saturday 26 September 2020. Our main aim for this endeavour is to raise funds for Oxfam GB and Gurkha Welfare Trust.

Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. However, we will be completing the run in one day as a team. Trailwalker 2020 like in previous years supports the work of both Oxfam GB and the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

Please kindly support our venture and donate towards these wonderful causes. Any sized donation would be highly appreciated and help us towards achieving our goal.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. We will be completing the event as a family, running and walking various routes, or just tramping circuits round the house and garden for those of us still shielding.

Our fundraising will go towards the work of both Oxfam and The Gurkha Welfare Trust. The Gurkha Welfare Trust, during the COVID-19 outbreak, have been able continue to provide vital support to Gurkha veterans, their families and communities in Nepal. During lockdown, their teams have been visiting vulnerable veteran and widow homes to check on their welfare, distribute medication and give out financial aid, as well as bringing clean water to peoples’ doorsteps.

Oxfam has been providing vital support like handwashing facilities, clean water, toilets and soap in the most vulnerable communities. Since March, Oxfam have reached over 4 million people across 62 countries and we won’t stop. Every donation is helping people hold onto hope. Your ongoing generosity is at the heart of everything we do.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
As part of the Events team at Oxfam, we had predicted 2020 to be a big year for both festivals, third-party events and for our event Trailwalker. However, it has been a roller coaster to say the least!

Although our events may have stopped, Oxfam's and The Gurkha Welfare Trust's essential and life-saving work has not. Oxfam has been responding, firstly to the threat of coronavirus, and then the reality of the pandemic sweeping across the world. Oxfam have been keeping families safe, supporting front line workers as well as providing food to vulnerable people. Oxfam are hoping to reach over 17 million people with hygiene kits, access to clean soap and water and food assistance. 

GWT have continued to provide support to Gurkha veterans, their communities and families despite the challenges that have been faced by their staff with lockdown measures being in place across Nepal. 

This is why continued support is so important. You can read more about their work below. 

Oxfam's work: https://www.oxfam.org.uk/oxfam-in-action/responding-coronavirus

GWT's work: https://www.gwt.org.uk/

I will be taking on the Trailwalker Relay with my team, collectively walking 100km and I will be walking 25km during the week of the 21st September. 

The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Dear All,
I have signed up to the 10k to help raise funds for Oxfam as sadly this year there were no Festivals to steward at - a source of huge funds for many years.  (Not as fit as when I ran 10km in London for Bhopal so will run/walk!)

Oxfam in Action UK & World wide:
In just 15 years, extreme poverty has been halved. 15 more years and we can end it for good.

Last Year - Over 22.2 million people reached  in 97 countries.Nearly 9 million people supported in 31 humanitarian emergencies.

SAFE, CLEAN WATER FOR ALL. RESPONDING IN EMERGENCIES. FIGHTING CLIMATE CHANGE. HEALTH & EDUCATION. WOMEN & GENDER JUSTICE.  HOLDING THE POWERFUL TO ACCOUNT.       
TACKLING THE CORONOVIRUS.
To fight coronavirus worldwide, we're hoping to support more than 17
million people with hygiene kits, clean water, soap and food. But this
pandemic is about more than just the virus itself. In Iraq we've set up a
gender helpline to help prevent violence against women during the crisis & in the cramped Rohingya camps in Bangladesh, local teams are providing hygiene training alongside clean water and sanitation, so people can protect themselves and spread the word. 

"We did not come here because we wanted aid. We came here to save our lives"

For more information search Oxfam GB

I am still deciding on my route - was thinking along the towpath from Bradford on Avon to Bath & then the bus back but in case it is pouring down I shall probably run halfway then back again & straight home for a hot shower! The 10k website says:

"It's a great way to set yourself a challenge, have some fun and get active while enjoying the physical and mental health benefits of running" I am so fortunate in many ways including being able to do this.

Every donation makes a difference. Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page. I will let you know how I get on!

Best Wishes

Gill










Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

As you may know, Benjamin and I did 'Couch to 5k' at the start of lockdown. I had never run before and worked really hard to push myself through the programme and then we succeeding in running for 30 mins straight within 9 weeks. I have continued to run and am now running 5km three times a week. Who would ever have believed it! 

Now Oxfam has asked for volunteers to run 10km to raise money for the vital work that they do. They help  fund crucial work like keeping the most vulnerable safe during the pandemic; providing families around the world with essentials like clean water, seeds, chickens and cash vouchers as well as supporting frontline medical and aid workers with equipment and supplies.

If you can donate just a little, it really will go a long way.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
I wanted to try this amazing challenge as I have spent the past 10 months recovering from a Coccygectomy operation (removal of the Coccyx....ouch). It’s been an incredibly long and painful recovery and I’m still not there yet, but I needed something to spur me on, something to look forward to, and something get stuck into. 

With my awesome team, I will do my very best to complete this challenge and would drag myself across the line if I have to.100km in just 30 hours!! My wife Georgina has had to help me and put up with me throughout this past 10 months and she will be joining me on the walk along with our good friends Ant and Laura Forbes.

Starting in Queen Elizabeth Country Park we will be walking along the South Downs Way on route to Brighton. We'll be starting out on the morning of 25th September and will continually walk until we arrive at our destination on the afternoon of the 26th.

We will be training for the next 9 months to prepare our poor feet for this 62 mile trek, in the meantime we would really appreciate your sponsorship!

Our goal is to raise £1400, all of which will go straight to Oxfam GB who are supporting those in poverty, those without clean drinking water, those in need of life saving basics and communities facing starvation.

It will also go towards The Gurkha Welfare Trust who are taking care of Gurkha veterans, their widows and their wider communities to ensure that they can live comfortably in their home country after serving in the British Army.

We're doing this for good causes, for the adventure, for the free curry at the end and we're just hoping we don't kill each other in the process.

Wish us luck!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Helllo!

So me and some of my milk friends are getting together to partake in a walking challenge! This involves us walking 100km (roughly 62 miles) in under 30 hrs. We will be walking throughout the night to ensure we complete the challenge.

Trailwalker UK supports the incredible work of both Oxfam Great Britain and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.


The Gurkhas are soldiers from Nepal who are recruited into the British Army and have been for over 200 years. They are renowned for their loyalty, professionalism and bravery. We ensure that Gurkha veterans, their widows and their wider communities are able to live with dignity in their home-country of Nepal.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. charity.name: Oxfam
story:
A powerful 7.4 magnitude earthquake has triggered a devastating tsunami on the Indonesian island of Sulawesi. 


Right now, people are still trapped. Families have been torn apart. Lives are on the line. There is no time to waste.

Oxfam joins The Disasters Emergency Committee (DEC) to launch an urgent public appeal. People are in desperate need of food, water and shelter  please help us reach them before its too late.

More than 2 million people could be affected by the disaster, which has forced thousands from their homes. The death toll has reached over 1300 people. 

And, as rescuers work around the clock to find survivors in the rubble, its expected to rise even further. Due to the scale of the destruction, we urgently need your help to get clean water, food and shelter to survivors in the worst hit areas.

Were aiming to reach 500,000 people in Palu city and Donggala district with life-saving supplies  but we cant do it without you.


Please help if you can and donate now.
title: Indonesia Earthquake and Tsunami Appeal
rememberedPersonSummary.name: NA
Name: Indonesia Earthquake and Tsunami Appeal

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit our JustGiving page.  We are raising money for Oxfam and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

The four of us work together and have decided that it will be fun to spend over 20 hours together in the middle of nowhere pushing our bodies to their limits in the name of charity.

We are walking 100km across the South Downs.  That is the equivalent of 2.5 marathons.  We aim to do this within 21 hours although we have until the 30 hour mark to finish.  Our personal best is 22 hours 54 minutes.  

There will be no sleeping but there will be lots of hills and no doubt lots of blisters.

The ascent is the same as Ben Nevis and Snowdon combined. 

£1400 is our target.  £1400 will give fresh water for 1400 people or will buy 200 mosquito nets to prevent malaria carrying mosquitos.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story: Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. As you train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, you will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money you raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. We will walk 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours as a team of four. 

I supported Paula when she did the challenge in 2012, so this time I'll be putting on my boots and she'll be in the support van.

The money we raise will help to end poverty around the world, supporting both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

The 2020 Trailwalker Challenge is taking place on 26-27 September. I will be organising a supper club and quiz night this summer to keep the fun in fundraising. Even if you can't make it, any donation you can give, even if it's just £5, will help spur us on to walk through the night and reach the finish line!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Oxfam is a global movement of millions of people who share the belief that, in a world rich in resources, poverty isn't inevitable.

From women's rights to water, earthquakes to education, we do life-changing, groundbreaking work in all sorts of areas and when an emergency hits, Oxfam is there. At any given time our teams are responding to an average of 25 emergencies worldwide.

Together with our local partners, we work in more than 90 countries as part of the Oxfam International confederation, to tackle the root causes of poverty and respond to emergencies.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
My name is Pix and I love walking! A couple of years ago I walked 41 miles in 10 hours for fun.....so now it's time to up the challenge to 100K or 62 miles along the South Downs way, in under 30 hrs!

Luckily I've managed to talk three 'more experienced athletes' into join me on this adventure. One is an Iron Man and Park run veteran (well, half an Iron Man), One is a banker who loves to run, One is a young physio and by far the most important member of the team. (Although he doesn't know it yet!)

Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. As you train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, you will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money you raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Too many people around the world live in cramped conditions, with no access to clean water or proper handwashing facilities, and are already facing crises like conflict and hunger. For these communities, coronavirus could be catastrophic.

Were doing everything we can to protect the poorest people from coronavirus. But we need your help to do more.

Your support helps us deliver soap, clean water and sanitation services such as handwashing facilities to keep more families safe.

Its a difficult time for everyone  but anything you can do to support can make a difference and save lives. Thank you.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
History Of TrailWalker

Exercise TRAILWALKER started out as a military training exercise in Hong Kong in 1981. Organised by the Queen’s Gurkha Signals, and taking place along the famous Maclehose Trail, the exercise sought to test the endurance and teamwork of soldiers of the Queen’s Gurkha Signals over a long and arduous course.

In 1986, Trailwalker was opened to civilian participation for the first time, and now, following the move of the Queen’s Gurkha Signals to the UK, the 100k event takes place across the South Downs, with hundreds of civilians setting off alongside the Gurkhas.

This Year

The Virtual Trailwalker Relay has been organised to challenge teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

story:
6 members from 247 Gurkha Signal Squadron will be running a distance of 100km from 21-27 September 20. The main aim of this event is to raise fund for Oxfam GB and Gurkha Welfare Trust, in order to support the Gurkha Veterans, their widows and wider communities back in Nepal. 

Your help in this matter is greatly appreciated.

Every little help matters.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
We've joined together to raise money for Oxfam and The Gurkha Welfare Trust by completing 100km between us during the week 21 to 27 September 2020.  This is the Virtual Trailwalker Relay, in lieu of the real, 100km-in-30hrs Trailwalker, which has been cancelled this year due to the ongoing pandemic.

We are a team of 5, so we have each committed to walking 20km during the week.  The Gurkhas are owed so much by this country - this is the chance to give something back... to them and to Oxfam.  Thank you!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Hi everyone (I hope someone actually reads this)!
As part of a group I will be taking part in Oxfam's Trailwalker Relay - exciting stuff. My personal goal will be to run/walk/crawl to Bath from Bristol and back (30miles ish) on Saturday 26th September. 

The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

I'm oversimplifying here but:

  • Oxfam work to beat poverty around the world.
  • The Gurkhas Welfare Trust help thousands of retired soldiers in Nepal - providing financial aid and have helped develop a comprehensive medical scheme across Nepal. 

Check out their websites for more info:

https://www.gwt.org.uk/about-us/mission-history/

https://www.oxfam.org.uk/

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

I stewarded with Oxfam at Trailwalker 2019 and would have normally spent the 2020 weekend covered in fairy lights and cheering those much braver than me who do 100km in one go !!

As this years' event was cancelled altogether, I can't steward this year, but I can certainly help raise funds by participating in the Virtual Trailwalker Relay between 21 and 27 September!

I intend to cover at least 50km during the week as I want to kill off my little toes even more  

Along with my teammates we will cover the 100k together during the week beginning 21 September. 

If you give generously I won't show you pictures of my blisters!!!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
For some reason we thought that walking 100 kilometres within 30 hours would be a good idea, so we've signed up for Trailwalker 2021! 

Starting in Queen Elizabeth Country Park we will be walking along the South Downs Way on route to Brighton. We'll be starting out on the morning of 25th September and will continually walk until we arrive at our destination on the afternoon of the 26th. 

We will be training for the next 9 months to prepare our poor feet for this 62 mile trek, in the meantime we would really appreciate your sponsorship! 

Our goal is to raise £1400, all of which will go straight to Oxfam GB who are supporting those in poverty, those without clean drinking water, those in need of life saving basics and communities facing starvation. 

It will also go towards The Gurkha Welfare Trust who are taking care of Gurkha veterans, their widows and their wider communities to ensure that they can live comfortably in their home country after serving in the British Army. 

We're doing this for good causes, for the adventure, for the free curry at the end and we're just hoping we don't kill each other in the process.

Wish us luck!

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
The Rehal Family will be doing Asa Ki Vaar Kirtan every Sunday. All funds will be donated to the Oxfam Coronavirus Emergency Response Appeal. Thank you

Too many people around the world live in cramped conditions, with no access to clean water or proper handwashing facilities, and are already facing crises like conflict and hunger. For these communities, coronavirus could be catastrophic.Were doing everything we can to protect the poorest people from coronavirus. But we need your help to do more.Your support helps us deliver soap, clean water and sanitation services such as handwashing facilities to keep more families safe.Its a difficult time for everyone but anything you can do to support can make a difference and save lives. Thank you.

story:
It always seems impossible, until it’s done!

Support us as we challenge ourselves to change lives over one incredible, life-changing, epic weekend.

The challenge is to run/walk 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 20 hours in a team of four. 

To help us get to the finish line, we will rely on our support crew.

The Walking Team - Miguel Morgado, Graeme Desombre and two other crazy people we still need to convince...

The Support Team -  Jolanta, Georgina

Thanks for your support!

story: Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. Our challenge is to walk, jog or run (mostly walk!) 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four. The team consists of four mums, Ceri Hughes, Karen Hedley, Ruth Walker, and myself and our gorgeous support crew (Stu and Soa - who will absolutely not be seeing this as an opportunity to get p***** in the van) to help us get to the finish line. As we train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, the money we raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust. Please support us - it's going to be tough and we need to make it worthwhile!

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit James, Tony, Louis, and Seb's JustGiving page.

James, Tony, Louis, and Seb are going to Trek 100km across the South Downs in under 30 hours and help end poverty with every step!

Organised with the Queen’s Gurkha Signals, Trailwalker is a unique opportunity for the team to put their minds and bodies to the test. 

Help The guys to raise money, push themselves to the limit, and face a challenge they’ll remember for the rest of their lives.

The Gurkha Welfare Trust ensures Gurkha veterans, their widows and their wider communities are able to live with dignity in their home-country of Nepal.

Oxfam is a global movement of people fighting the injustice of poverty around the world. Find out more, and how you can get involved, by visiting; https://oxfamapps.org/trailwalker/

*Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.*

story: The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust. We walked the Pembrokeshire Coast Path from St Anne's Head to Strumble Head via St David's Head. We are so proud to have done this, because we are not in the first flush of youth, so this is was a serious challenge for us and we have really appreciated your support.  We can never forget that, how ever hard this is, it is nothing compared to the lives of those supported by Oxfam and the Gurkha Welfare Trust

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
If you didn't know, I work for Oxfam. Fundraising events have been majorly impacted this year, and Trailwalker- usually an epic 100km in 24hours walk has been pared down to a team relay. 

With 6 of my Insight team colleagues (plus a few extras roped in) we're going to walk the 100km between us. Not a huge feat but something to hang some fundraising on in this strange year. 

Please donate a few pounds to us, as corona virus hasn't made poverty any less of an issue in 2020. Imagine having to face the double jeopardy of staying home to starve or working and risking corona. Of facing war alongside corona. Of not having access to the medical facilities we still take for granted.

story:
The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

I have worked for Oxfam for nearly 24 years and will be retiring on the 10th November.  This is a great opportunity to raise funds and to work with other members of my team at Oxfam, before I leave. I aim to walk every day of Trailwalker week, and cover at least 50 kilometres.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
The challenge is to walk, jog, run or crawl 100km across the South Downs in under 30 hours - although our target is to finish in under 18 hours as a team of 4 - Cat, Helen, Leona and Matt.

Why? 

  1. Nobody should have to live in poverty.
  2. Nobody should have to live without clean water and sanitation.

Trailwalker supports the work of Oxfam, who work tirelessly to keep families out of poverty and provide water and sanitation to those who need it around the world. 

None of us have completed an event of this distance or time before, but by completing this event, we hope to raise 2000 pounds to help Oxfam with their work.

If you can afford to donate, even just a pound, a dollar or a dirham - we would be incredibly grateful.

If you cant, please share the link - you never know who might see this and chip in :-)

Cheers,

Cat, Helen, Leona and Matt x

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Trailwalker UK supports the incredible work of both Oxfam Great Britain and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

I wanted to do something..... something special, something to give back, something that would challenge me to work hard, maintain fitness and help to end poverty....

The 100km Trailwalker Challenge in under 30 hours feels like the perfect thing. Its tough, its a marathon event and its going to take some serious commitment & motivation - of which I possess in bundles.

I'm grateful for your support in this, I appreciate you and together I hope we can put an end to poverty

Thanks
Andy

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
We wanted to take on a big challenge for a good cause. Walking 100km non-stop day and night to help those in poverty seemed to fit the bill. Your donations to help those less fortunate would be hugely appreciated.

Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. The money raised will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.description: Oxfam is a global movement of people who won’t live with the injustice of poverty. Together we save lives in disasters. We help people build better lives for themselves. We speak out on the big issues, like inequality and climate change. And we won’t stop until we end poverty for everyone. Join us
charity.name: Oxfam
story:
It's about time to do something challenging for a good cause. So here we are: 

Trailwalker UK 2020 challenge is on!!!

Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. We as a team have to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours. We will have a support team to help us get to the finish line (if you want to volunteer and be a part of our amazing support crew, please do contact us). As we train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, we will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money we raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

In a build up to this main event we hope to take on various other challenges throughout:

Fleet Half-Marathon (March 2020)

Everest Base Camp Trek (May 2020)

...........................

"Don't Limit your Challenges, Challenge your Limits"

Thank you in advance for your generous donation and support.

Many Thanks,

Ramesh, Sandip, Bishnu & Chandan (aka Boks Gang) lol

story:
Thanks for taking the time to visit my JustGiving page.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four. Myself, Will Potter, Joe Merriweather and Charlie Head have accepted the challenge and will be attempting to complete the course in under 15 hours. Please help us achieve our target of £1,400 as this won't only help the chosen charities but it will also motivate us to complete this mammoth undertaking. 

The money you help raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Before we all go off to live our lives as adults (terrifying!), we wanted to complete a big long bimble in the lovely South Downs together to raise money for the Gurkha Welfare Trust! Last year we completed our first half marathon together (except Charlotte, who likes to run ultras for fun...she's crazy!), this year we're going even further (5x further) and would love your support! Thank you everyone in advance, we so appreciate it! Love from your favourite, part-time grannies! X

Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. As you train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2020, you will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money you raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
We were super bummed that we couldn't be at Trailwalker this year, but that's no reason why we can't swap our wellie-boots for walking-boots this September to raise money for Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust. 

It's also a great opportunity for Zara, Hermione, Andreea and I to get creative, appreciate the beauty of our local areas and work together to reach our combined target of 100km across 21 - 27 September while raising £350+ for both charities.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
10 members from Lima Troop, 248 Gurkha Signal Squadron will take part in Virtual Trailwalker Relay from 21-27 Sep 20, organised by Oxfam. 100km will be split among the participating members and they will complete it carrying 15 kg weight in a bergen. This event will be executed following the government guidelines on social distancing.

The fund raising will aid two excellent charities- Gurkha Welfare Trust (GWT) and Oxfam.

GWT ensure that Gurkha veterans, their widows and their wider communities are able to live with dignity in their home-country of Nepal providing financial, medical and community aid.

Oxfam, a charity that involves the global movement of people fighting the injustice of poverty around the world.

Your donation for this noble cause will not just support those who are in need right now but also for those in the future.

Thank you.

Thank you for supporting The Yakety Yaks. Our team ; Jo, Suzanne, Laura, Donna, Andy, Sian, Ali, Paul & Lynda are trekking in relay from 21st September as many Kms as possible (which will be in excess of 100kms) to support Oxfam & The Gurkha Welfare Trust).  

The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Can the Gilfeather - Milsom - Gaffey clan manage to walk 100km between them in one week? We’d love you to sponsor us to make sure we do!

Last September we were all together for a Gilfeathering in Portugal, enjoying walks to the beach and through forests to beautiful waterfalls. This year we‘re all spread out between Britian and Spain, so instead of our family holiday, after a summer of meeting virtually on Zoom calls, we’re walking together virtually.

We’ve taken on the Trailwalker Relay challenge to walk 100km between us in 7 days. Our family challenge will help families around the world facing the real challenges of poverty, hunger and injustice.

The Trailwalker Relay is a challenge for teams to walk 100km collectively, splitting up the distance between their team members and completing it in the space of a week. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.
title: Trailwalker Relay 2020

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
Hello, Namaste, we are team Paach Pals and we shall be undertaking the arduous Trailwaker relay spanning from 21st -27th September.

The 100km distance will be done collectively between the five of us, where each individual shall cover 20km. This event supports the work of both Oxfam GB and the Gurkha Welfare Trust (GWT).

Oxfam delivers support to communities facing injustice and poverty by providing hand washing facilities, clean water, toilets and soap in the most vulnerable communities facing disaster. They have an extensive collection of operations which span over 11 countries.

The objective of Gurkha Welfare Trust is to support ex Gurkha servicemen and their dependants that require assistance. This is done so by distributing medical and financial aid, as well as clean water in rural villages.

As we are the descendants of 2nd, 3rd, 4th generation Gurkha soldiers, we recognise the importance of the work Gurkha Welfare Trust provide to the veterans in Nepal. In particular, during this present time where COVID-19 has affected the performances usually carried out by GWT members.

Therefore, we appreciate any contribution towards our target goal however big or small your donation may be!

Thank you for your help and generosity,

Sarina, Roma, Praniya, Sabrina and Sanjiv

TEAM PAACH PALS

story:
Esme and I will be walking 10k through the streets of London to raise money for Oxfam. Thank you for any contribution you can make.

Donating through JustGiving is simple, fast and totally secure. Your details are safe with JustGiving - they'll never sell them on or send unwanted emails. Once you donate, they'll send your money directly to the charity. So it's the most efficient way to donate - saving time and cutting costs for the charity.

story: Trailwalker is the ultimate team endurance event. The challenge is to walk, jog or run 100km non-stop across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours in a team of four, with a support crew of two members to help you get to the finish line. As you train, trek and fundraise for Trailwalker 2021, you will be helping to end poverty around the world. The money you raise will support both the work of Oxfam as well as the Gurkha Welfare Trust.

A decent 100km time on foot with no injuries across the south downs from Petersfield to Brighton would also be a bonus!

Dig as deep into your pockets as you feel you can. Thank you.

charity.name: Oxfam
story:
“Loggers and Cloggers” are a team of more-than-middle-aged but decidedly less than seniors who need to get up out of our rocking chairs and are mad enough to want a challenge.  What better incentive is there than to do it for charity as part of Trailwalker 2021, supporting the great work of Oxfam Great Britain and The Ghurka Welfare Trust.  We’ll be walking 100km NON-STOP across the South Downs Way in under 30 hours, ably supported by our brother, and wingman, Dave.  Funds raised will help provide financial, medical and development aid to Ghurka veterans, their families and communities in Nepal but also support Oxfam’s work, whether that be responding to a climate emergency, providing people with clean water and sanitation, campaigning against the laws which keep people in poverty or facing the real challenges presented by Covid-19.

Dave Waters aka "Biggles" is our invaluable support and very much our 5th team member. He will be staying awake (hopefully) throughout the duration of our trek, fixing blisters, transporting kit, making us a cuppa, bacon sarnie, pot noodle and anything else we phone ahead for before reaching checkpoints (he doesn't know about that bit yet!).

Thank you for visiting our page and we genuinely appreciate every donation made -  it’s a big trek to raise some life-changing money for a great cause and it’ll help make the pain of every inevitable blister more worthwhile!

story:
Trailwalker UK supports the incredible work of both Oxfam Great Britain and The Gurkha Welfare Trust.

Kitty and I walked the White Horse Trail last summer and fell in love with walking over the chalk downlands. We then moved on to the Ridgeway, walking from Marlborough to Ivinghoe Beacon, often with Izzy who was staying at home. We then went the other way on the Wessex Ridgeway, aiming for Lyme Regis before winter curtailed us. The South Downs Way will be a new and really tough challenge, walking non-stop, through the night with two of our gorgeous daughters, Izzy and Alicia.
